section.p: Ceph is an open source, scalable, software-defined storage (SDS) platform that provides block and object storage with unified management.
The Ceph storage solution provides an unified, scalable, and stable storage solution for the management of the HPE Helion OpenStack volume storage (Cinder persistent volumes) service.
For more information about installation, configuration, and integration between and Ceph Firefly 0.80.7 running on the hlinux kernel 3.14.44-1, see .

section.note: Ceph upgrade is a built-in, integral part of the HPE Helion Lifecycle Management upgrade, and is in line with rest of the supported services. In , the supported version of Ceph is Firefly 0.80.7. In upcoming releases, new versions of Ceph will be supported and the cluster can be upgraded to new releases. You should not use other releases of Ceph (for example, Firefly 0.80.10) and run Ceph upgrade verbs to upgrade the cluster. Doing this might cause a cluster stability issue.

section.title: Efficiently Creating Bootable Volumes when using Ceph for Glance and Cinder
section.note: This section only applies if you are using Ceph as a backend for both Glance and Cinder. If you are only using Ceph as a backend for either Glance or Cinder, but not both, then this section would not apply.
section.p: By default, creation of multiple bootable volumes from an image in Glance can involve significant data movement. When Ceph is used as a backend for both Glance and Cinder, performance of these operations can be improved significantly. Glance can be configured (using the v2 API) to pass image locations to its client, and the Ceph backend can be configured to read the image locations and use an efficient Ceph clone operation to avoid data copies.
section.note: Image locations can only be made available with the Glance v2 API, which is not the default.

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/cinder/cinder.conf.j2 file and add the following line: glance_api_version = 2

Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/glance/glance-api.conf.j2 file to uncomment and change the following line:
from: #show_image_direct_url = False
to: show_image_direct_url = True
Add the following line to the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/glance/glance-api.conf.j2 file: show_multiple_locations = True
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Use the playbook below to create a deployment directory: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml

Change to the deployment directory and run both the Glance and Cinder reconfigure playbooks: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts glance-reconfigure.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts cinder-reconfigure.yml
